intro: Frangula hintonii, commonly known as Hinton's buckthorn, is a species of shrub native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes other plants such as citrus and buckthorn species. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark, berry-like fruits. Frangula hintonii is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
